statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: Shaquille O'Neal scored 26 points as the Los Angeles Lakers rallied from a nine-point deficit late in the third quarter and beat the Memphis Grizzlies 100-85 Friday night for Phil Jackson's 700th victory as an NBA coach.
article.headline: With late rally, Lakers avenge earlier loss in Memphis

images.name: Bryant, Kobe 020201 inline
images.caption: Kobe Bryant was double-teamed most of the night, but slipped past Shane Battier on this drive.

article.linkText: Lakers beat Memphis for Jackson's 700th win
article.story:
MEMPHIS, Tenn. (AP) -- Phil Jackson's coaching resume just keeps getting better. Shaquille O'Neal scored 26 points as the Los Angeles Lakers rallied from a nine-point deficit late in the third quarter and beat the Memphis Grizzlies 100-85 Friday night for Jackson's 700th victory as an NBA coach. "It's a great, great thing to go by and move on ahead," Jackson said. "It's just a very elite number. It was probably more important than when I passed Red Holtzman (his former Knicks coach) last week. That was symbolic for me." Jackson already was the only coach to win more than one NBA title with two different teams counting his six championships with the Chicago Bulls and the past two with the Lakers. He now is only the 13th NBA coach with 700 wins, improving his career record to 700-246 in his 12th season. Memphis coach Sidney Lowe called Jackson a great coach. "The way he deals with his players, works with his players. He can get his players to play. The way he handles situations, he's very good at it. But ... I'm sure it's nice to sit over there though," Lowe said. The Grizzlies looked ready to upset the two-time defending champions for the second time in Memphis as they led after each of the first three quarters. They were ahead 69-60 with 1:16 left in the third quarter, but that's when the Lakers finally got going. Kobe Bryant, who shot 5-of-13 from the floor, started the Lakers on a 38-8 run. Derek Fisher added consecutive 3-pointers to pull Los Angeles within 69-68 at the end of the third, and O'Neal scored eight points during the stretch that finished with the Lakers leading 98-77. Fisher added 21 points off the bench, Bryant finished with 13 as the Grizzlies double-teamed him much of the game and Rick Fox had 11 as the Lakers won their third straight. "We saved the best for last," Jackson said. "We got it going again in the third quarter. Derek Fisher was a terrific input in the game tonight." Jackson had worried that his Lakers might lack motivation against a team they have dominated. Even though the Lakers lost to the Grizzlies for only the second time ever when they came to Memphis in December, they won their two games in Los Angeles by an average margin of 31.5 points. The Grizzlies, playing before only their fifth sellout crowd of the season, shot 50 percent from the floor and took care of the ball in leading for most of second and third quarters. The Lakers led only once in the second quarter and struggled, turning the ball over three times on shot clock violations in the first half. "We had to turn it up in the second half," O'Neal said. "Teams like this always play well against us. ... The last time, they got away with one. We just wanted to come in this time and make sure it didn't happen." Memphis led 69-60 on a putback by Stromile Swift with 1:16 left in the third. Then the Grizzlies started rushing shots, while the Lakers couldn't miss. Pau Gasol and Brevin Knight each had 13 points for Memphis. Grant Long and Swift had 10 apiece. Knight said the Grizzlies were worn out at the end with Jason Williams sidelined for his third straight game. "It's just numbers now. We've got guys playing 40-plus minutes that many games in a row, you're going to get a game where you can't do it. That's impossible. In the fourth quarter, it hit us. They made a run and got it down, then I think our tanks just went empty," Knight said.

Game notes
Fisher was 5-of-7 from 3-point range and four assists. ... The Lakers now are 25-2 against the Grizzlies. ... Grizzlies coach Sidney Lowe said Williams will miss Sunday's game against Charlotte, his fourth game following the removal of two ingrown toenails. ... Jackson needs eight victories to pass John MacLeod for 12th place on the all-time list. ... The Lakers dominated inside, outscoring the Grizzlies 48-32 in the paint.
